options: Breaking 'make dinner' into: shop, prep, cook, serve

options: Wake up, wash, dress, eat, travel

options: Solve problems faster by reusing solutions

Why is abstraction useful?
options: Simplifies problems by removing unnecessary detail

questions.question: When making a sandwich, you use abstraction by:
options: Not worrying where wheat was grown

questions.question: A map uses abstraction by:
options: Showing roads but not every tree

questions.question: Which uses abstraction?
options: Tube map showing just lines and stations
Detailed street map with every building

questions.question: In programming, abstraction helps by:
options: Hiding complex code behind simple commands

questions.question: When using a calculator, you use abstraction because:
options: You don't need to know how it works inside

questions.question: A good example of abstraction is:
options: Driving without knowing how engine works

questions.question: Algorithms must be:
options: Clear and in the right order

questions.question: A good algorithm is:
options: Easy to follow and gets result

questions.question: An algorithm for crossing a road might include:
options: Stop, look, listen, cross when safe

options: Battery, motor, braking, entertainment - all of these

options: Both hardware (sensors, cameras) and software (AI, navigation)

options: Decomposition - break into: data collection, processing, display, alerts

Why is computational thinking useful beyond computing?
options: It's a problem-solving method for any field

questions.question: How does decomposition help with revision?
options: Break subjects into topics, topics into subtopics

questions.question: How does abstraction help when learning to drive?
options: Focus on driving skills, not engine mechanics

questions.question: Pattern recognition in history helps you:
options: Spot causes and effects across events

questions.question: Why do modern devices use embedded systems instead of full computers?
options: Cheaper, smaller, designed for specific task

questions.question: Why can't software run without hardware?
options: Software needs physical components to execute on

questions.question: Why can't hardware work without software?
options: Hardware needs instructions to know what to do

questions.question: How has computer science changed healthcare?
options: Digital records, scans, analysis, remote monitoring - all of these

questions.question: What's the main benefit of computational thinking?
Why is pattern recognition important in AI?
options: AI learns by spotting patterns in data

questions.question: How does abstraction make systems more user-friendly?
Why do games need both input and output?
options: Input for control, output for feedback

questions.question: What's the relationship between hardware and software?
Why learn computer science if you don't want to be a programmer?
options: Develops problem-solving, logic, creativity for any career

questions.question: How do embedded systems improve car safety?
Why is decomposition the first step in problem-solving?
options: Can't solve complex problems without breaking them down

questions.question: How has the Internet of Things (IoT) used embedded systems?
options: Computers in everyday devices connect to internet

questions.question: Why is algorithm design considered a computational thinking skill?
options: Creating systematic solutions is core to CS

questions.question: What makes embedded systems different from regular computers?
options: Designed for specific task, built into device

questions.question: Describe one way decomposition could help plan a school trip.
options: Break into: choose destination, arrange transport, book activities, plan meals

questions.question: Give an example of pattern recognition in everyday life.
options: Noticing same route to school is quickest

questions.question: Explain why a Tube map is a good example of abstraction.
options: Shows essential info (lines, stations) but removes unnecessary details (exact distances, buildings)

questions.question: Why are algorithms important in computing?
options: Provide clear, repeatable instructions for solving problems

questions.question: Name two input devices and two output devices.
options: Input: keyboard, mouse; Output: monitor, printer

questions.question: What is the difference between hardware and software?
options: Hardware is physical; software is programs/instructions

questions.question: Give three examples of embedded systems.
options: Washing machine, car engine computer, smart TV

questions.question: Explain Input → Process → Output using an ATM example.
options: Insert card (input), check PIN (process), dispense cash (output)

questions.question: Why does a computer need both hardware and software?
options: Hardware provides physical components, software provides instructions

questions.question: Name two careers that use computer science skills.
options: Software developer, data scientist (or any two from lesson)

questions.question: Describe the four pillars of computational thinking.
options: Decomposition, Pattern Recognition, Abstraction, Algorithm Design

questions.question: Explain how a smart thermostat uses computational thinking.
options: Decomposes temperature control, recognizes patterns in schedule, abstracts user needs, algorithms for heating

questions.question: Why are embedded systems used in modern cars?
options: Control engine, safety features, entertainment automatically

questions.question: Compare an operating system and application software.
options: OS manages computer/runs programs; apps do specific tasks

questions.question: Explain why abstraction is useful when using technology.
options: Can use devices without understanding complex internal workings

questions.question: How does pattern recognition help when learning?
options: Spot similar problems, reuse solutions, learn faster

questions.question: Describe the role of the CPU in a computer system.
options: Processes data, executes instructions, controls computer

questions.question: Give an example of a device that needs both hardware and software to function.
options: Smartphone (hardware: screen, processor; software: apps, OS)

questions.question: Explain how computational thinking helps in subjects beyond computing.
options: Provides systematic problem-solving approach for any subject

questions.question: Why is Computer Science important in modern society?
options: Underpins technology in all sectors: medicine, transport, communication, etc.

options: Software developer, data scientist, cybersecurity, many more

options: Automate devices and perform specific tasks efficiently

options: Computer Science is about logical problem-solving
